relation: 1809 Brick Colonial fully renovated with old character and modern conveniences.
1865 Gothic-revival home in the historic town of Willow Street, in the heart of Lancaster County.
Older part built in 1826, "newer" part in 1884 The inn now in its 10th year, and a part of Select Registry - Distinguished Inns of North America.
Built as a single-family home in 1872. Was a rooming house and an apartment building. Converted into a B&B in 1994.
Was a stop on the "Underground Railroad"; opened as a B&B in 1994 w/4 guest rooms; expanded in 2004 to 8 rooms
The mansion at Rocky Springs Park was built in 1855 as a tavern; our 17 acres was half of an amusement park and includes the carousel building

textAfterTable: DBA-doing business as    DNR-did not respond    NA-not applicable    NR-not ranked The Central Penn Business Journal's list of bed and breakfasts is limited to those in or near Adams, Cumberland, Dauphin, Lancaster, Lebanon, Perry or York counties. Information came from individual inns and other Business Journal research. To access the Business Journal's online database, visit www.CPBJnow.com/ListCentral. Surveys available at www.CPBJsurveys.info; follow @CPBJListCentral on Twitter. Published online.     Researched by Alaine Keisling
